name: Cardiovascular Disease
definition: A group of disorders that affect the heart and blood vessels and can lead to serious events such as heart attack or stroke.
types: Coronary Artery Disease: A condition where the coronary arteries become narrowed or blocked due to plaque buildup.
Hypertension: A disorder in which blood pressure remains consistently high, increasing strain on the heart and arteries.
Heart Failure: A condition where the heart is unable to pump blood efficiently to meet the body's needs.
Arrhythmia: A disorder characterized by irregular heartbeats caused by problems in the heartâ€™s electrical system.
Congenital Heart Disease: A structural defect in the heart that is present from birth.
causes: High blood pressure damages artery walls and increases the risk of heart-related disorders.
High cholesterol leads to plaque formation in blood vessels, restricting blood flow.
Smoking introduces toxic chemicals that damage blood vessels and the heart.
Obesity increases workload on the heart and disrupts normal metabolic functions.
Genetic factors increase susceptibility to cardiovascular conditions.
symptoms: Chest pain or discomfort due to reduced blood flow to the heart.
Shortness of breath during physical activity or rest.
Fatigue caused by inefficient blood circulation.
Swelling in legs, ankles, or feet due to fluid retention.
preventionStrategy: Maintain a healthy diet low in saturated fats and salt.
Avoid smoking and limit alcohol consumption.

name: Diabetes Mellitus
definition: A chronic metabolic disorder characterized by elevated blood glucose levels due to impaired insulin production or function.
types: Type 1 Diabetes: A lifelong condition where the body's immune system attacks and destroys insulin-producing cells.
Type 2 Diabetes: A condition in which the body becomes resistant to insulin or does not produce enough insulin.
Gestational Diabetes: A temporary form of diabetes that develops during pregnancy and usually resolves after childbirth.
causes: Autoimmune reactions destroy insulin-producing beta cells in the pancreas.
Insulin resistance prevents body cells from effectively using insulin.
Obesity interferes with insulin action and glucose metabolism.
Genetic predisposition increases the likelihood of developing diabetes.

name: Epilepsy
definition: A neurological disorder marked by recurrent seizures caused by abnormal electrical activity in the brain.
types: Focal Seizures: Seizures that originate in a specific area of the brain.
Generalized Seizures: Seizures that affect both sides of the brain.
Unknown Onset Seizures: Seizures with unknown origin.

name: Asthma
definition: A chronic respiratory disease in which the airways become inflamed, narrowed, and produce excess mucus.
types: Allergic Asthma.
Non-allergic Asthma.
Exercise-induced Asthma.

name: Cancer
definition: A disease characterized by uncontrolled growth and spread of abnormal cells in the body.
types: Carcinoma.
Sarcoma.
Leukemia.
Lymphoma.
Melanoma.

name: Alzheimer's Disease
definition: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder that leads to memory loss and cognitive decline.
types: Early-onset Alzheimer's.
Late-onset Alzheimer's.

name: Tuberculosis
definition: A contagious bacterial disease that primarily affects the lungs.
types: Pulmonary Tuberculosis.
Extrapulmonary Tuberculosis.

name: Hypertension
definition: A chronic condition in which blood pressure remains persistently elevated.
types: Primary Hypertension.
Secondary Hypertension.

name: Chronic Kidney Disease
definition: A long-term condition in which the kidneys gradually lose their ability to filter waste.
types: Acute Kidney Injury.
Chronic Kidney Failure.

name: Liver Cirrhosis
definition: A late-stage liver disease characterized by scarring and permanent damage.
types: Alcoholic Cirrhosis.
Biliary Cirrhosis.
Post-hepatitis Cirrhosis.

name: Migraine
definition: A neurological condition characterized by recurrent, severe headaches often accompanied by sensory disturbances.
types: Migraine without Aura: A common form of migraine that causes intense headache pain without any visual or sensory warning signs.
Migraine with Aura: A type of migraine preceded by visual disturbances such as flashing lights or blind spots.
Chronic Migraine: A condition where migraine headaches occur for 15 or more days per month.
Hemiplegic Migraine: A rare migraine type that causes temporary paralysis or weakness on one side of the body.
causes: Genetic factors influence sensitivity of brain chemicals involved in pain transmission.
Hormonal changes, particularly in women, can trigger migraine attacks.
Stress affects neurotransmitter balance and triggers headache episodes.
Certain foods and beverages stimulate migraine onset.
symptoms: Throbbing headache pain usually on one side of the head.
Visual disturbances such as flashing lights.
preventionStrategy: Maintain regular sleep and eating schedules.

name: Anemia
definition: A condition in which the blood lacks sufficient healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to body tissues.
types: Iron Deficiency Anemia: A condition caused by insufficient iron leading to reduced hemoglobin production.
Vitamin Deficiency Anemia: An anemia caused by lack of vitamin B12 or folate.
Aplastic Anemia: A rare disorder where the bone marrow fails to produce enough blood cells.
Hemolytic Anemia: A condition where red blood cells are destroyed faster than they are produced.
causes: Iron deficiency due to poor diet or blood loss.
Vitamin B12 or folate deficiency affects red blood cell production.
Chronic diseases interfere with blood cell formation.
Genetic disorders affect red blood cell lifespan.
preventionStrategy: Take supplements if advised by a doctor.
Regular blood tests for early detection.

name: Osteoporosis
definition: A bone disease that occurs when bone mineral density decreases, making bones weak and fragile.
types: Primary Osteoporosis: A condition related to aging and hormonal changes, especially after menopause.
Secondary Osteoporosis: Bone loss caused by medical conditions or long-term medication use.
causes: Hormonal imbalance, especially low estrogen levels.
Insufficient calcium and vitamin D intake.
symptoms: Back pain due to fractured vertebrae.
preventionStrategy: Ensure adequate calcium and vitamin D intake.
Avoid smoking and excessive alcohol consumption.
Bone density screening for early detection.

name: Depression
definition: A mental health disorder characterized by persistent feelings of sadness, loss of interest, and impaired daily functioning.
types: Major Depressive Disorder: A severe form of depression that interferes with daily life activities.
Persistent Depressive Disorder: A chronic form of depression lasting for two years or more.
Postpartum Depression: Depression that occurs after childbirth due to hormonal and emotional changes.
Seasonal Affective Disorder: Depression related to changes in seasons, typically occurring in winter.
causes: Chemical imbalances in the brain affect mood regulation.
Traumatic life events increase emotional vulnerability.
Genetic predisposition influences mental health conditions.
symptoms: Loss of interest in daily activities.

name: Pneumonia
definition: An infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid or pus.
types: Bacterial Pneumonia: A lung infection caused by bacteria such as Streptococcus pneumoniae.
Viral Pneumonia: Pneumonia caused by viruses including influenza.
Fungal Pneumonia: A lung infection caused by inhaling fungal spores.
Aspiration Pneumonia: Pneumonia caused by inhaling food, liquid, or vomit into the lungs.
causes: Bacterial or viral infections attack lung tissue.
Weakened immune system increases infection risk.
Prolonged hospitalization exposes patients to pathogens.
